name: Poly Multisample
description: This algorithm is inspired by the original “SD Multisample” algorithm on the disting EX, with hints of the Crossfade Loop Synth (https://www.expert-sleepers.co.uk/xfadelooper.html) [91] VST plug-in, and the “Audio Playback with Crossfade” algorithm on the disting mk4 (video here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x3bmglh36mE) [92]. It is a polyphonic sample playback instrument, playing WAV files from the MicroSD card. It can also record audio (i.e., sample in the traditional sense) and play that. It can apply crossfade looping to make smooth looping pads out of any sample material. It can be played via CV/gate, MIDI, or I2C. It supports both velocity switches and round robins per sample.

parameters.name: Folder
parameters.description: Sets the sample folder to use.

parameters.name: Sample
parameters.description:
Allows you to choose a single sample within the
folder to play, or "" for the usual case where you want the algorithm to choose the sample automatically based on the note pitch.

parameters.name: Crossfade
parameters.description:
Sets the crossfade looping mode: Off, Forwards, or
Alternating.

parameters.name: Crossfade
parameters.description:
Sets the length of the crossfade, as a percentage of
the loop time (the difference between the loop point and end trim point).

parameters.name: Loop point coarse
parameters.description:
Sets the loop point, as a percentage of the sample
length.

parameters.name: Loop point fine
parameters.description: Adjusts the loop point, in sample frames.

parameters.name: Sustain mode
parameters.description: The standard polysynth sustain mode parameter. See above.

parameters.name: Sustain
parameters.description: Directly controls the sustain (like a MIDI sustain pedal).

parameters.name: Gate offset
parameters.description:
Offsets (delays) the gate inputs relative to the pitch
inputs.

parameters.name: Loop
parameters.description:
Sets whether the sample will loop. ‘From WAV file’
will loop if the sample has loop points defined in the
file – see above – and not otherwise. ‘Off’ and ‘On’
force the sample to loop or not.

parameters.name: Confirm change
parameters.description:
Sets whether the folder and/or sample changes
immediately or requires confirmation.

parameters.name: Envelope
parameters.description:
Enables an ADSR volume envelope. If the
envelope is disabled, the sample simply plays once
until the end.

parameters.name: Attack
parameters.description: Sets the envelope attack time (from 1ms to 15s,<exponential response).
